group_1.textCenter: I see; I understand now -@that this was a big mistake after all.
I know you were doing it for my sake,@but I'm not too happy about this,
so I will be scolding you.

group_1.textLeft: That's right, you are in trouble,@so please sit there.

group_1.narration: ―Rabi―@If you do not understand something,@you should ask about it first.
―Rabi―@You don't do any of this on a regular basis,@so of course you would have no idea.
―Rabi―@Even before, when you were overjoyed@with your perfect score,
―Rabi―@you would get too distracted at times,@Lady Nayuta.
―Rabi―@The same holds true when you search for your father.@You need to pay more attention to your surroundings.
―Rabi―@Because when you don't do that,@you don't see where you're going,
―Rabi―@and you end up spilling a bucket.
―Rabi―@Mikage, that is admirable of you, but in a situation like this,@the responsibility falls on Lady Nayuta...

group_1.textLeft: Okay, it seems you two have reflected@on your actions, so the scolding is over.

group_1.textRight: Then I must ask, why have you returned,@Rabi?

group_1.textLeft: I still had some spare time,@so I came back for lunch.
Also, I was worried about@how you might be, Lady Nayuta.

group_1.textRight: Oh my... You have no confidence in me.

group_1.textLeft: Coming back here like I normally would@was the right thing to do, but...
Well, let's all start cleaning this up.

group_1.textRight: Eh?! Rabi, what about your plans@for this afternoon?

group_1.textLeft: I will give up the rest of my time off, of course.@Half of a day was plenty of rest for me.
There is nothing I can do if you do not@approve of it. I will leave the cleaning to you.
Now Rabi has taken her leave again.
We can get back to cleaning and@preparing the party.
